result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Milanowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution in the amount of $10,357.60 to Tyler K.


10-20-15/ Dennis R. Cimpl
Due to typographical error, restitutiuon was mis-stated.  Restitution is  ordered in the amount of $1,357.60 to Tyler K.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $10357.60 to Tyler K.
Pay DNA surcharges.
Court waives all other court costs due to the restitution ordered.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs; no possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with Tyler K or his family.

Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence and if the follow probation conditions have been met:  no contact with the victim. no new law violations, full payment of restitution and completion of community service.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Anger management.
Provide a DNA sample.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With Huber for work. Good time to apply.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Reflects corrected restitution amount (and surcharge amounts). 
Corrected CR-154 to DOC
Due to a typographical error restitution was mis-stated.  Restitution is in the amount of $1357.60 to Tyler K.

Defendant Andrew J Milanowski in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Tom Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.
  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- Condition time in the House of Correction for 45 days with Huber for work.  Good time to apply.  Court does not object to electronic monitioring.
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs; no possession of drug paraphernalia
- Random urine screens
- No contact with Tyler K or his family
- 100 hours of community service.
- anger management 
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $10357.60 to Tyler K
Pay DNA surcharges;
Court waives all other court costs due to the restitution ordered.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentence Referral form
Letters on behalf of the defendant

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence and if the follow probation conditions have been met:  no contact with the victim. no new law violations, full payment of restitution and completion of community service.

As to the Amended Charge:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Filed:  Victim Impact Statement
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.

Defendant Andrew J Milanowski in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information and waived formal reading.
Court ordered charge amended to Substanial Battery, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(2), 939.50(3)(i), 939.63(1)(c) , a Class I Felony  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Milanowski in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Milanowski in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Milanowski in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tyler K. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant Andrew J Milanowski in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 05-01-2015 at 01:30pm
